Articles.Content:
I got my Steam Community BETA Access today and found this:

http://steamcommunity.com/greenlight/

And they say every developer can show their game on greenlight... so i thought why not Kerbal Space Program?

For the devs: just got to "For developers" ;D

Really awesome what the guys behind Steam build there. I love it.

I hope you guys like it too

PS: I was not allowed to add tags to this topic... and there are only 48 tags in the cloud... this should be allowed for everyone.

Edited August 21, 2012 by Byter
Tags :P

well, I think the way squad is distributing KSP so far has been enough, steam ads restrictions in the area of addons, mods and other problems, although it would get it the attention it needs on launch day

Exactly.

And mods are no problem? Just use Steam's Workshop

I think Greenlight is the perfect way to get even more attention to KSP. Thats why I posted it here. Whether I did it today or someone else does it in one week doesnt matter

well, I think the way squad is distributing KSP so far has been enough, steam ads restrictions in the area of addons, mods and other problems, although it would get it the attention it needs on launch day

Please use the search feature. This has already been posted repeatedly and discussed to death.

Oh no not this thread again.

Bingo. This has been bought up a number of times and the thread always deteriorates into a battle of why to and why not to release the game on Steam.

You can easily find the previous threads by doing forum searches with either "steam" or "greenlight" as the keywords.
